title: The GUI can output CSV files, but the "refine" command in batch processing cannot
body:
Thanks for opening this issue, and thanks for using DeepLabCut (we hope you are enjoying it ;). Please fill out the template completely, including the full "traceback" and input code that you ran to hit this error. **Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Operating system: Ubuntu,Anaconda Env, Deeplabcut 2.2 Please complete the following information about your system: OS: [e.g. MacOS, Windows 10, etc] DeepLabCut Version: [e.g. 2.2] (please check with import deeplabcut, deeplabcut.__version__) Anaconda env used: **Describe the problem** I directly execute refine on the command line to get only ".h5" and no .csv files, whereas I can get .csv files using "Filter Tracks" in Refine tracklets of GUI. When I want to batch processing, how can I get CSV files without a GUI interface? Thank you for reading. A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Please place code inside this:
Code output

![MC0V_1Z~C3ANJBU KIK_DZD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77730747/105174657-d8a96b80-5b5d-11eb-915b-4e0e9def7990.png) ![MC0V_1Z~C3ANJBU KIK_DZD](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77730747/105174703-ec54d200-5b5d-11eb-8336-9bac83abc004.png) `import os import deeplabcut prefix= '/mnt/Ti_Cr-hjh-2021-01-18/addvideos/' config_path = '/mnt/Ti_Cr-hjh-2021-01-18/config.yaml' datanames = os.listdir('/mnt/Ti_Cr-hjh-2021-01-18/addvideos/') _bx = [] vd = [] for dataname in datanames: print(dataname[-10:]) if dataname[-10:] == '_bx.pickle': dataname1 = prefix + dataname _bx.append(dataname1) for dataname in datanames: if os.path.splitext(dataname)[1] == '.MP4': dataname1 = prefix + dataname vd.append(dataname1) vd.sort() _bx.sort() print(len(_bx),len(vd)) for i in range(50): bx_file_path = _bx[i] videofile_path = vd[i] print(_bx[i],vd[i]) deeplabcut.refine_tracklets(config_path, bx_file_path, videofile_path, min_swap_len=2, min_tracklet_len=2, trail_len=50) print("good")`

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to '...' 2. Click on '....' 3. Scroll down to '....' 4. See error **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. **Additional context** Add any other context about the problem here. No more questions, thank you
